login_meta_description: Access your CanAccesible account to report incidents, manage your profile, and contribute to a more inclusive environment.
register_meta_description: Create an account on CanAccesible and join the accessibility community in the Canary Islands. Your participation is key!
home_meta_title: CanAccesible - For islands accessible to all
home_meta_description: Community platform to report and improve accessibility in the Canary Islands. Join us and help create more inclusive islands.
mission_text:
CanAccesible is a community platform designed to transform the Canary Islands into a benchmark for accessibility.

It allows anyone to register, share, and improve the accessibility of public and private places, fostering a more inclusive environment for the entire community.
service_report_desc: Document architectural barriers or highlight good accessibility practices. Your voice helps identify areas for improvement.
service_map_desc: Explore the state of accessibility in real time. View critical points and accessible areas across all the islands.
service_contact_desc: If you have any questions, suggestions, or need assistance, don't hesitate to contact us. We're here to help.
how_it_works_subtitle: Three simple steps to make a real change.
step_identify_desc: Observe your surroundings. Is there a blocked ramp? A traffic light without sound? Or a perfectly adapted venue?
step_report_desc: Use the app to upload a photo, geolocate the point, and describe the incident in seconds.
step_improve_desc: Your report notifies the community and authorities, driving actions to remove the barrier.
about_us_text1: CANACCESIBLE was born in the classrooms of IES El Rinc√≥n as a final cycle project, but with its heart set on the streets of the Canary Islands. We are a team of three students passionate about technology and social impact.
about_us_text2: We believe that programming is a powerful tool to break down barriers. What started as a simple idea among classmates today seeks to be the voice of a community that demands and deserves real accessibility.
about_us_footer: Created with ‚ù§Ô∏è by 2nd year DAW students at IES El Rinc√≥n
passion_desc: We develop software thinking about people.
innovation_desc: We use the latest technologies to create a seamless experience.
learning_desc: A project that seeks to have a real impact on the world.
commitment_desc: Dedicated to improving quality of life through accessibility.
cta_subtitle: Your participation is key to improving accessibility in the Canary Islands. Sign up today and start collaborating.
footer_description: CANACCESIBLE promotes a more inclusive world through technology and digital accessibility.
contact_meta_description: Contact the CanAccesible team. Resolve doubts, report incidents and get support about accessibility in the Canary Islands.
contact_account_support_desc: Having trouble with your account or need assistance with your profile?
contact_report_incident_desc: Found an obstacle or problem that affects accessibility?
contact_accessibility_resources_desc: Need help finding guides, tools, or resources?
contact_general_inquiry_desc: Any other questions, suggestions, or ideas to improve the platform?
contact_accessibility_support_desc: Need help? We are committed to inclusion.
contact_login_required: You must log in to start a conversation.
chat_no_messages: No messages yet. Start the conversation!
confirm_delete_message: Are you sure you want to delete this message?
chat_login_required: You must log in to access this conversation.
blog_not_found_desc: The article you're looking for does not exist.
incidents_meta_description: Explore and report architectural barriers in the Canary Islands. Help identify and solve accessibility issues on our islands.

incidents_sent_for_review: The incident has been sent for review.

incidents_follow_login: You must log in to follow an incident.

map_meta_description: Interactive map of accessibility in the Canary Islands. Find and report accessible points and architectural barriers near you.

terms_intro_text: Welcome to CANACCESIBLE. These Terms and Conditions govern your access to and use of the website and all related services. By accessing or using this Platform, you agree to be bound by these Terms.
terms_license_text: CANACCESIBLE grants you a limited, non-exclusive, revocable, and non-transferable license to access and use the Platform solely for personal and non-commercial purposes. You agree not to:
terms_license_li1: Reproduce, distribute, modify, or transmit the content without authorization.
terms_license_li2: Attempt to access restricted features without permissions.
terms_license_li3: Use bots, scrapers, or other automated means to access the Platform.
terms_license_li4: Transmit viruses, malware, or other malicious code.
terms_license_li5: Interfere with the secure functionality of the Platform.
terms_accounts_text: To access certain functionalities of CANACCESIBLE, you may need to create an account. You are responsible for:
terms_accounts_li1: Providing accurate, truthful, and complete information during registration.
terms_accounts_li2: Maintaining the confidentiality of your password.
terms_accounts_li3: Accepting responsibility for all activities that occur under your account.
terms_accounts_li4: Immediately notifying any unauthorized access to your account.
terms_accounts_note: We reserve the right to suspend or delete accounts that breach these Terms.
terms_reporting_text: CANACCESIBLE allows users to report accessibility issues and incidents. When reporting:
terms_reporting_li1: You declare that the information provided is truthful and accurate.
terms_reporting_li2: You agree that CANACCESIBLE may moderate, edit, or delete inappropriate reports.
terms_reporting_li3: You understand that CANACCESIBLE is not responsible for actions taken by third parties based on your reports.
terms_reporting_li4: You consent that shared images and data may be used to improve accessibility.
terms_ownership_text: All content published on CANACCESIBLE (including images, text, and data) is owned by:
terms_ownership_li1: CANACCESIBLE Content: Is the exclusive property of CANACCESIBLE and is protected by copyright.
terms_ownership_li2: User Content: You retain ownership of the content you create, but grant CANACCESIBLE a perpetual, royalty-free license to use, modify, and distribute such content.
terms_conduct_li1: Post offensive, discriminatory, illegal, or defamatory content.
terms_conduct_li2: Harass, threaten, or intimidate other users.
terms_conduct_li3: Violate third-party privacy or intellectual property rights.
terms_conduct_li4: Spam or engage in unauthorized advertising.
terms_liability_text: To the maximum extent permitted by law, CANACCESIBLE shall not be liable for:
terms_liability_li1: Loss of data, revenue, or profits.
terms_liability_li2: Damages caused by malware, viruses, or security attacks.
terms_liability_li3: Problems arising from misuse of the Platform.
terms_liability_li4: Actions of third parties or users.
terms_indemnification_text: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless CANACCESIBLE, its officers, employees, and agents from any claims, demands, losses, or expenses (including legal fees) arising from your breach of these Terms or your misuse of the Platform.
terms_termination_text: CANACCESIBLE reserves the right to suspend or terminate access to the Platform without prior notice if:
terms_termination_li1: You violate these Terms or applicable laws.
terms_termination_li2: You engage in fraudulent or malicious activities.
terms_termination_li3: You engage in abusive conduct towards other users.
terms_changes_text: CANACCESIBLE reserves the right to modify these Terms at any time. Significant changes will be notified via email or through a prominent notice on the Platform. Your continued use of the Platform after changes constitutes acceptance of the modified Terms.
terms_law_text: These Terms are governed by the laws of Spain. Any dispute arising from these Terms will be resolved exclusively by the competent courts of Spain.
terms_contact_text: If you have questions about these Terms and Conditions, please contact us:
privacy_intro_text: At CANACCESIBLE, we are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring that you have a positive experience on our website. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you visit our website.
privacy_collect_text: We may collect information from you in various ways, including:
privacy_collect_li1: Registration information: Name, email, password, and other details provided during registration.
privacy_collect_li2: Profile information: Data you voluntarily provide in your user profile.
privacy_collect_li3: Browsing information: IP address, browser type, pages visited, and visit duration.
privacy_collect_li4: Cookies: We use cookies to improve your browsing experience.
privacy_use_text: We use the information we collect to:
privacy_use_li1: Provide, operate, and maintain our website.
privacy_use_li2: Improve, personalize, and expand our services.
privacy_use_li3: Understand how users interact with our site.
privacy_use_li4: Comply with legal and regulatory obligations.
privacy_gdpr_text: In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), we process your data under the following legal bases:
privacy_gdpr_li1: Consent: For marketing communications and analytical tracking.
privacy_gdpr_li2: Contract execution: To register your account and provide access to our services.
privacy_gdpr_li3: Legal compliance: To comply with applicable tax and legal obligations.
privacy_gdpr_li4: Legitimate interest: To improve our services, detect fraud, and ensure security.
privacy_cookies_text: We use different types of cookies:
privacy_cookies_li1: Technical cookies: Necessary for site operation (authentication, preferences).
privacy_cookies_manage: How to manage your cookies: You can control or delete cookies through your browser settings. Most browsers allow you to reject cookies or warn you when they are sent. Please note that disabling cookies may affect the functionality of our site.
privacy_recipients_text: We share your data with the following third parties when necessary:
privacy_recipients_li1: Hosting providers: Secure data storage and website operation.
privacy_recipients_li3: Cloud storage providers: DigitalOcean Spaces for managing content (images, files).
privacy_recipients_note: All our providers are required to protect your data and may only use it for specified purposes.
privacy_transfers_text: Some of our providers may be located outside the European Union, including:
privacy_transfers_li1: Services in the United States: Some hosting and analytics providers may process data in the U.S.
privacy_transfers_li2: Protection guarantees: These providers must comply with International Data Transfer Agreements or other protection measures recognized by the EU.
privacy_transfers_note: We ensure that any data transfer outside the EU complies with GDPR and uses appropriate protection mechanisms such as Standard Contractual Clauses.
privacy_protection_text: We implement technical, administrative, and physical security measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. This includes SSL encryption, firewalls, and restricted access to sensitive data.
privacy_retention_text: We retain your personal information only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, unless the law requires or permits a longer retention period. Once information is no longer needed, we securely delete it.
privacy_rights_text: Under GDPR and Spanish legislation, you have the following rights:
privacy_rights_li1: Right of access: Request what personal data we have about you.
privacy_rights_li2: Right to rectification: Correct inaccurate or incomplete data.
privacy_rights_li3: Right to erasure: Request deletion of your data in certain cases.
privacy_rights_li4: Right to restriction of processing: Restrict how we process your data.
privacy_rights_li5: Right to data portability: Receive your data in a structured and portable format.
privacy_rights_li6: Right to object to processing: Object to the processing of your data for specific purposes.
privacy_rights_li7: Right to withdraw consent: Withdraw your consent at any time.
privacy_rights_li8: Right to file a complaint: File a complaint with the Spanish Data Protection Agency (AEPD).
privacy_rights_note: To exercise any of these rights, contact us through the information provided in the Contact section.
privacy_updates_text: We reserve the right to update this Privacy Policy at any time to reflect changes in our practices, technology, or for legal reasons. We will notify you of significant changes through:
privacy_updates_li1: Updating the "Last updated" date on this page.
privacy_updates_li2: Displaying a prominent notice on our website.
privacy_updates_note: Your continued use of the site after changes means you accept the updated Privacy Policy.
privacy_contact_text: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us:
push_intro_text: Push notifications allow you to receive important alerts from CanAccesible directly on your device, even when you don't have the application open in your browser.
push_important: Important: To receive push notifications, you need to enable them both in your browser and in your operating system settings (Windows, macOS, etc.).
push_step1_li1: Log in to your CanAccesible account
push_step1_li2: Go to your Profile (click on your name in the upper right corner)
push_step1_li4: Toggle the switch to allow notifications
push_chrome_li1: Click the lock icon (üîí) in the address bar
push_chrome_li4: If it doesn't appear, click the notifications icon (üîî) in the address bar
push_firefox_li1: Click the shield icon (üõ°Ô∏è) in the address bar
push_edge_li1: Click the lock icon (üîí) in the address bar
push_windows_li3: Turn on "Get notifications from apps and other senders"
push_windows_li4: Look for "CanAccesible" in the apps list
push_macos_li5: Make sure "Show notifications in Notification Center" is enabled
push_not_receiving_li1: Make sure your browser is up to date
push_not_receiving_li2: Check that you haven't blocked notifications in your browser
push_not_receiving_li3: Make sure CanAccesible is enabled in Windows/macOS settings
push_not_receiving_li4: Try reloading the page and enabling notifications again
push_no_sound: Notifications appear but don't make a sound?
push_no_sound_li1: Go to Windows Settings ‚Üí System ‚Üí Sound
push_no_sound_li2: Make sure the overall volume is not muted
push_no_sound_li3: Verify that app notifications can play sound
push_success_text: Perfect! You will now receive push notifications from CanAccesible when there are new replies in your support conversations, important updates, and more.
form_error_image: You must upload an image before continuing.
